page.title: 06LIVING ON A FARM IN 1985
page.content: Living on a farm in 1985 is good fun but hard work. The work includes silage making, hay making,feeding the animals, milking cows and ploughing. An average farm is approximately 150 acres and about three tractors,and an average herd of cows consists of about 75. To do hay making the grass is cut by a mower and then scattered by a hay bob. It is then left to dry and then set in rows, baled,and kept in a shed for winter food. When silaging, the grass is cut by a mower and then a forage harvester picks it up and loads it into a trailer to take for storing in the silage pit.The silage, like the hay is used for feeding cows and heifers in the winter. From the corn stalks straw is made and used for bedding down the animals. Anne Johnson & Christopher Hembrow,11
